answers.definition: A group of living organisms that are similar.
answers.sentence: All breeds of dogs large and small are actually members of the same species.

wrongs: A place where animals can live.
Animals
Trees and plants
Smelly gas.

answers.definition: To give (someone) knowledge or understanding of something.
answers.sentence: The teacher wanted to familiarize his class with some of the challenges that handicapped kids face.

wrongs: To make someone part of a family.
To make someone bored with endless details.
To be mean to someone.
To challenge someone.

answers.definition: Well known from long or close association.
answers.sentence: The old house gave him a warm familiar feeling, but he would swear he'd never been there before.

wrongs: very old, ancient
friendly and kind.
Too hot.
Exhausting.

answers.definition: A person who concentrates primarily on a particular subject or activity.
answers.sentence: The other doctors, all generalists, weren't going to be able to help with this rare problem, but he could: he was a specialist.

wrongs: Someone who is great at everything.
Someone who is over-confident.
Someone who is special.
Someone who speaks with a funny accent.

answers.definition: An pursuit, area of study, or skill that someone is an expert in
answers.sentence: Amanda will coordinate with the other groups and I will solve the enormous problems -- those are my speciality.

wrongs: A common refrain.
A challenge that involves lots of other people.
Something you're particularly bad at.
When you know you are gonna win.

answers.definition: Close knowledge of something or someone.
answers.sentence: People most enjoy listening to the music that they have a high degree of familiarity with.

wrongs: When people or animals look like other people or animals.
The quality of finding something new.
The quality of being together in a group.
Really really old.

answers.definition: Clearly defined.
answers.sentence: I can't help you without specific instructions.

wrongs: Important or highly regarded.
unspecific
repeatedly repeating repeatedly
like a dark and hard to see through cloud.

answers.definition: To identify clearly and definitely.
answers.sentence: Could you specify exactly which chicken nuggets you want?

wrongs: To make something small.
To speak loudly.
To wonder aloud in a way that makes everyone tired..
To dig with a large shovel.

answers.definition: Having interest in; participating in something.
answers.sentence: Luis dropped out of the club, but his brother is still an active member.

answers.definition: Moving about, doing something
answers.sentence: A surprising number of animals are active at night, including opossums, raccoons, and porcupines

wrongs: Extremely lethargic; sleepy.
Ravenous, starving.
Noxious, having a terrible smell.
Deafeningly loud.

answers.definition: Something one does besides schoolwork.
answers.sentence: The activity that Spencer likes best is playing word games on the Internet.

answers.definition: Motion, movement
answers.sentence: The food booths had a great deal of activity during last Saturday's fall festival.

wrongs: Staying extremely still.
Boredom.
Having a lush green color.
Noise.

answers.definition: A person who plays roles in movies, television shows and on stage; a performer.
answers.sentence: That actor played a pilot in one movie and a detective in another.

wrongs: Someone who wakes people up as a profession.
A person who is extremely rich.
Someone who is always moving about frantically.
A person who likes or is drawn to mysteries.

answers.definition: Really, in fact.
answers.sentence: I thought I would finish the thirty-minute test in fifteen minutes, but actually I took the entire half hour.

wrongs: How something feels, but is not really.
Done in a way that is always moving about.
Done in an entertaining manner for an audience.
In an annoying manner.

answers.definition: To make into law.
answers.sentence: Our congressman worked to enact a bill that would bring more money to the schools.

answers.definition: To act out a part in a play.
answers.sentence: Kit will enact the role of Dorothy in The Wizard of Oz.

wrongs: To pretend in a way that is convincing.
To try to get something to happen for real.
To eliminate something that is burdensome.
To try and learn a challenging skill.

answers.definition: A person with an important position in a particular group, such as a club or the armed services.
answers.sentence: The Student Council has four officers -- president, vice-president, secretary, and treasurer.

answers.definition: A policeman or a policewoman.
answers.sentence: At the car accident, one officer directed traffic and another talked to the two drivers.

wrongs: A person who disables electronics from consuming electricity.
A nosy person, a busybody.
A person who does work generally seen as undesireable.
A Pokemon.

answers.definition: A person who holds an office or is in a position of authority such as a mayor, a referee, or a diplomat.
answers.sentence: Our top city official is Mayor Ramos.

wrongs: Someone who removes insects from humans or animals.
A person in charge of keeping food or drinks very cold.
An animal trainer.
A builder of Yo-Kai watches.

answers.definition: To supervise a special event or game.
answers.sentence: Out English teacher, Ms. Mason, will officiate at the state spelling bee.

wrongs: To remove the ruts and grooves that have accumulated on a rink.
To consume food when or where it is not expected.
To get all the answers correct in a test or quiz.
To yell loudly at various people even when they aren't paying attention.

answers.definition: To interest greatly, to capture the attention or affection of, to charm.
answers.sentence: Sue was captivated by the mystery novel.

wrongs: To exhaust completely, to tire.
To literally put someone in a cage.
When shipwrecked sailors draw lots.
To annoy someone thoroughly.

answers.definition: A person who is taken or captured; someone caught and held as prisoner.
answers.sentence: After the knight and his followers lost the battle, they were taken as captives to the queen.

wrongs: A person who puts removable lids on bottles and jars.
A formal guest.
A prize of great worth.
Someone who wears faboulous hats; someone who makes them.

answers.definition: The condition of being a captive, of not being free.
answers.sentence: The tiger that we saw at the zoo is the largest one in captivity.

wrongs: The condition of being dehydrated from heat.
A restaurant that specializes in hot drinks.
The condition of being extremy angry.
The quality of being extremely interesting to a lot of people.

answers.definition: To take or capture again, to bring back.
answers.sentence: On Bonnie's second trip to camp, she could not recapture the thrill she had felt on her last trip.

wrongs: A small opening in a wall that emits terrible smells.
When something feels truly extraordinary.
To describe something very clearly.
To find something hidden.

answers.definition: Spoken or written words, expressing an idea.
answers.sentence: The students worked to make the statement of the purpose of their project very clear.

wrongs: The subterranean floor of a local government building.
When your mouth feels all tingly after too much strongly flavored gum.
When a group of people scream loudly so as to distract others.
A covering for a book or painting that protects what's inside.

answers.definition: Not moving, motionless, fixed in place.
answers.sentence: The train remained stationary while the passengers boarded.

wrongs: Of or pertaining to a set of related tv shows or movies.
Moving too fast to be considered safe.
Sticking to a strict or rigorous schedule; on time.
Cold and quiet.

answers.definition: An image carved, cast or molded in various materials such as stone wood, or metal.
answers.sentence: The statue of George Washington stood at the entrance to the park.

wrongs: A written dedication to someone great.
A beautiful painting, made from a set of bright colors.
A child, grandchild or descendant.
A carefully crafted gate with a person's initials engraved on it.

answers.definition: To present as less important than it really is, to make little of to deny the seriousness of.
answers.sentence: Bella was so brave that she understated the amount of pain she felt from her broken arm.

wrongs: To say something very quietly so that few people can hear.
To oppose; to resist.
The bottom-part of a carved piece of art.
A place where people who wear glasses can clean each other's lenses without fear.
